summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the Epstein case. They are coordinating access to case files, including draft indictments and defense submissions, which are too large to send via email and require share drive access.
keyFacts: Email chain dated January 23-24, 2019 shows U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York personnel actively working on the Epstein case.
Case files discussed include draft indictments and defense submissions, indicating ongoing legal preparation.
Files were described as too large to send via email, requiring share drive access for distribution.
One sender notes 'Prepare to be disgusted' in reference to the Epstein materials, suggesting disturbing content.
The correspondence involves a Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
